text: Ben Riley (July 17, 1933 – November 18, 2017) was an American jazz drummer. He was born in Savannah, Georgia. He was known for his work with Thelonious Monk, as well as Alice Coltrane, Stan Getz, Woody Herman, Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis, Ahmad Jamal, Kenny Barron, and as member of the group Sphere. During the 1970s he was a member of the New York Jazz Quartet. Riley died on November 18, 2017 in West Islip, New York at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== * Ben Riley — Drummerworld * Interview with Ben Riley — by Don Williams for All About Jazz Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American drummers Category:Musicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:People from Savannah, Georgia
